asset.name: KT-485
asset.one_liner: Second-generation oral IRAK4 degrader - combined activity of upstream biologics (anti-IL-1/18/33/36) in a pill

biology.simple_explanation: IRAK4 is a master regulator of innate immunity that sits at the crossroads of multiple inflammatory pathways. When cytokines like IL-1, IL-18, IL-33, or IL-36 bind their receptors, or when TLRs detect danger signals, IRAK4 is the critical node that transmits the signal to cause inflammation.

dual_function.scaffolding_function: Physically brings together signaling components (MyD88, IRAK1/2) in the 'Myddosome' complex
dual_function.key_insight: Traditional kinase inhibitors can only block ~50% of IRAK4 function. DEGRADATION eliminates BOTH kinase AND scaffolding functions - the only way to fully block the pathway

upstream_signals.receptors: TLR2, TLR4, TLR5, TLR7, TLR8, TLR9

pathway_detail.signaling_cascade: Receptor activation → MyD88 recruitment → IRAK4 → IRAK1/2 → TRAF6 → NF-κB → Inflammatory gene transcription
pathway_detail.outputs: Th1, Th2, and Th17 inflammatory cytokines

biology.why_obligate_node: IRAK4 is required for ALL MyD88-dependent signaling. Without functional IRAK4, the entire IL-1R/TLR pathway is blocked.

genetic_validation.finding: Adult humans with IRAK4 null mutations are HEALTHY
genetic_validation.implication: Natural experiment proving complete IRAK4 elimination is safe
genetic_validation.caveat: IRAK4-null children have increased susceptibility to pyogenic bacterial infections, but this resolves with age

clinical_pathway_validation.description: Multiple drugs validate the pathways upstream and downstream of IRAK4

validated_pathways.indications: RA, CAPS, HS, AD, Recurrent Pericarditis, Gout

clinical_pathway_validation.key_insight: IRAK4 degradation could achieve the COMBINED activity of anti-IL-1 + anti-IL-18 + anti-IL-33 + anti-IL-36 biologics in one oral pill

why_degrader_not_inhibitor.inhibitor_limitation: IRAK4 has essential SCAFFOLDING function that kinase inhibitors cannot block
why_degrader_not_inhibitor.published_evidence: Clinical IRAK4 kinase inhibitors have shown limited efficacy, likely because scaffolding function remains
why_degrader_not_inhibitor.degrader_advantage: Complete protein elimination blocks both kinase AND scaffolding - full pathway shutdown

mechanism.how_it_works: KT-485 binds IRAK4 and recruits an E3 ligase to ubiquitinate and degrade the entire IRAK4 protein, eliminating both kinase and scaffolding functions

partnership.who_controls_development: Sanofi (development lead); Kymera provides discovery and research support
strategic_value: Sanofi has deep I&I expertise and commercial infrastructure

lead.name: Hidradenitis Suppurativa (HS)
lead.rationale: IL-1 pathway validated; high unmet need; no oral options

market_opportunity.unique_value_proposition: Combined activity of multiple upstream biologics in one oral drug

kt485_vs_kt474.description: KT-485 is the second-generation IRAK4 degrader that improves on KT-474

kt474_issues: Development discontinued in favor of KT-485
kt485_improvements: Prioritized by Sanofi for clinical development

kt485_vs_kt474.analyst_note: The QTc issue with KT-474 was a setback, but KT-485 addresses this. Sanofi's decision to advance KT-485 validates that the improvement is meaningful.

clinical_data.status: No human data for KT-485 yet
clinical_data.kt474_learnings: Learnings from KT-474 clinical studies will be applied to accelerate KT-485 development

phase1.kymera_role: Learnings and support from KT-474 program

claims.claim: Degrader blocks both kinase AND scaffolding function vs kinase inhibitors blocking only kinase
claims.supporting_data: IRAK4 has essential scaffolding function in Myddosome assembly; kinase inhibitors leave scaffolding intact, blocking only ~50% of function

claims.claim: Oral once-daily dosing vs injectable biologics
claims.supporting_data: KT-485 is oral; Anakinra/Canakinumab/Spesolimab are injectable

claims.claim: Combined activity of anti-IL-1 + anti-IL-18 + anti-IL-33 + anti-IL-36 in one molecule
claims.supporting_data: IRAK4 sits at convergence of IL-1R, IL-18R, ST2, IL-36R signaling; degradation blocks all simultaneously

claims.claim: No QTc signal vs first-generation KT-474
claims.supporting_data: KT-474 had QTc prolongation signal; KT-485 designed to eliminate this; Sanofi prioritized KT-485
claims.caveat: Based on preclinical data only, not confirmed in humans.

bull_case.point: Human genetic validation - IRAK4 null adults are healthy
bull_case.evidence: Natural experiment proving safety of complete IRAK4 elimination

bull_case.point: Degrader mechanism uniquely enables full pathway blockade
bull_case.evidence: Scaffolding function cannot be blocked by inhibitors

bull_case.point: Sanofi partnership validates target and molecule
Multiple validated pathways converge on IRAK4
bull_case.evidence: IL-1, IL-18, IL-33, IL-36 all signal through IRAK4
KT-485 has no QTc signal vs KT-474

bear_case.point: KT-474 QTc issue raises questions about chemistry
bear_case.counter_argument: KT-485 specifically designed to eliminate QTc; Sanofi convinced

bear_case.point: IRAK4 inhibitors have shown limited efficacy clinically
bear_case.evidence: Pfizer and others had disappointing IRAK4i results
bear_case.counter_argument: Inhibitors don't block scaffolding function - degraders are different
bear_case.probability: Medium - need to prove degrader is better

bear_case.point: Sanofi controls development - limited Kymera visibility
bear_case.counter_argument: Partnership structure preserves economics; Sanofi has expertise

key_debates.question: Is scaffolding function blockade clinically meaningful?
key_debates.bull_view: Yes - explains why IRAK4 inhibitors failed; degraders will succeed
key_debates.bear_view: Unknown - hypothesis not yet proven in humans
key_debates.what_resolves_it: KT-485 Phase 2 efficacy vs historical IRAK4 inhibitor data

economics_to_kymera.net_impact: Positive NPV with limited ongoing investment

competitive_landscape.limitation: Only block kinase activity, not scaffolding function; disappointing clinical efficacy to date
competitive_landscape.differentiation: Inhibitors cannot block scaffolding function; limited efficacy

competitive_landscape.limitation: Injectable; only block IL-1 pathway (IRAK4 sits at convergence of IL-1, IL-18, IL-33, IL-36)
competitive_landscape.differentiation: Biologics are injectable; IRAK4 degrader is oral and blocks multiple cytokines

competitive_landscape.limitation: Injectable; only blocks IL-36 pathway; approved for GPP flares only, not broader I&I
competitive_landscape.differentiation: Spesolimab only blocks IL-36; IRAK4 blocks IL-1 + IL-18 + IL-33 + IL-36
